Superior Court of New Jersey, Law Division — Atlantic County

ATL-L-002794-25 – Barber v. Tumelty

ATL-L-002794-25 · Docket ATL-L-002794-25

Case Type
Civil Action (Attorney Misconduct / Contract and Tort Claims)
My Role
Plaintiff
Status
Closed
Forum
Trial Court
Judge
Hon. Sarah B. Johnson, J.S.C.

ATL-L-002794-25 – Barber v. Tumelty

Case Overview

This Law Division action was closed on January 9, 2026, by Hon. Sarah B. Johnson, J.S.C., who advised Plaintiff Devon Tyler Barber that, once Plaintiff’s post-conviction relief (PCR) is adjudicated, Plaintiff may refile the complaint against John W. Tumelty, Esq. and The Law Offices of John W. Tumelty. The case originally arose from Defendants’ alleged failure to perform agreed legal services after accepting a retainer in connection with Plaintiff’s pretrial detention and related criminal proceedings.

Plaintiff had alleged that Defendants abandoned representation, failed to communicate, failed to pursue available pretrial remedies, and retained fees without providing contracted services. The action asserted multiple independent causes of action sounding in contract, tort, and statute, rather than a single malpractice theory alone.

Claims Asserted

Plaintiff’s operative pleadings asserted claims including, but not limited to:

  • Breach of contract;
  • Breach of fiduciary duty;
  • Common-law fraud and fraudulent misrepresentation;
  • Violation of the New Jersey Consumer Fraud Act;
  • Negligence and professional misconduct;
  • Unjust enrichment;
  • Limited conviction-dependent legal malpractice (pled in the alternative and expressly preserved).
